name: 1,2,3,4-Tetrafluorobenzene
Reason: 1,2,3,4-Tetrafluorobenzene has a melting point of -11.2°C, which is significantly lower than that of benzene (5.5°C). This is due to the presence of four fluorine atoms, which increase the molecular weight and electronegativity of the molecule, leading to stronger intermolecular interactions and a lower melting point.
